name: The Indigo Girls Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: The song 'Secure Yourself' is really about...
questions.explanation:
The death of Amy's cat.

	Both of the Indigo Girls are vegetarians and are sensitive to animal issues.

questions.text: Why is the band called the 'Indigo Girls'?
questions.correct: Amy picked the word out of a dictionary because it sounded 'cool'
options: It was a takeoff on 'blues music'
From the title of Emily's favorite book
questions.explanation:
Amy picked the word out of a dictionary because it sounded 'cool'.

	Several songs and albums also have the same origin- for example, "Swamp Ophelia" was named after a flower they saw on a trip to Florida.

questions.text: This is the Indigo Girls' signature song, played at the end of almost every concert. Some of its lyrics are 'I spent four years prostrate to the higher mind,got my paper and I was free'
questions.explanation:
Closer to Fine.

	It's a song about believing in oneself.

questions.text: The album 'Swamp Ophelia' was named after
questions.explanation:
A flower.

	However, exactly what flower it was is a matter of conjecture- probably they misheard "psammophilia."

questions.text: What song do the following lyrics come from? 'How long till my soul gets it right? Can any human being ever reach that kind of light'?
questions.explanation:
Galileo.

	Galileo is used as a metaphor for the search for meaning.

questions.text: What song are the following lyrics from- 'I am an only child, born of the wild. riddled to spend my time defending my land.'?
questions.explanation:
Chickenman.

	The Chickenman was a real person that the Indigo Girls met on a road trip.

questions.text: Amy and Emily, together with another famous songwriter, wrote an anti-fur song called 'I Will Give you My Skin' for a benefit album for People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals. Who was the third songwriter?
questions.explanation:
Michael Stipe.

	Like most REM songs, this one didn't make much sense lyrically.

questions.text: In the song 'Shed your Skin', Amy sings, '115, you are 17'. What is she talking about?
questions.correct: The number of poisonous snakes in the U.S.
options: The number of corrupt dictators in the world
questions.explanation:
The number of poisonous snakes in the U.S.

	Of 115 species of snake in the U.S., 17 are poisonous.

questions.text: Which of the following songs is about imperialism in South America?
questions.explanation:
Scooter Boys.

	Many Indigo Girls songs reference the world's injustices.

questions.text: One easy question...Who the heck are the Indigo Girls, anyway?
questions.explanation:
Amy Ray and Emily Saliers.

	They have been together, as artists,for many yers.
